definition:
Two representations of groupoids
$(\mu_i, U_{{{\mathsf{G}}}} * {\mathcal H}, L_i)$ , for $i=1,2$ are
called *equivalent* if $\mu_1 \sim \mu_2$, and if there also exists a
fiber-preserving isomorphism of analytical Hilbert space bundles
$v: (U_{{{\mathsf{G}}}}* {\mathcal H}_1)|_U \longrightarrow (U_{{{\mathsf{G}}}}* {\mathcal H}_2)|_U$
, where $U$ is a measurable subset of $U_{{{\mathsf{G}}}}$ of null
complementarity; the isomorphism $v$ also has the following property:
$\hat{v}[r(x)]\hat{L}_1(x) = \hat{L}_2 \hat{v}[d(x)]$ for
$x \in {{\mathsf{G}}}|_U $.
